Details:
Updates and Decisions-
Finances
Chair Rotation: decide on process for chair rotation
Membership: decide on desired outcomes and process for recruitment
Awards:  decide on process
Legislative Session: draft/discuss ideas for the 2014 legislative session.
External Review: decide whether or not to proceed
iMapInvasives:  decide whether or not to continue participation 
Communications strategy:  decide on next steps
Advisory committee:  decide on purpose, potential, next steps
100 worst:  agree to list for 2014; decide on next steps

Presentations ➤ Increased Understanding-
Council Member Updates 
Consumer Perception - marketing approach/feral cats
iMap Invasives
Tunicates
Green Crabs
Shipping and Transport of Invasive Species

Meeting Location: Oregon Department of Forestry, 2600 State Street, Building C, Clatsop Room
BLM North Bend Office 1300 Airport Lane
Details: - Sudden Oak Death – Ellen Goheen, USFS Plant Pathologist at the Southwest Oregon Forest Insect and Disease Service Center. - Local Topics—Several speakers will inform Council members of their challenges addressing invasive species issues in the Coos Bay/Charleston area. Discussion with local legislators—Sen. Arnie Roblan, Rep. Caddy McKeown. Wrinkled Dune Snail—Ann Ferguson, USDA-APHIS PPQ. Smallmouth bass in the Coquille Basin—Rick Boatner, ODFW. Biocontrol for Himalayan Blackberry and Gorse—Tim Butler, ODA. Spartina along the Coast of Oregon—Vanessa Howard, PSU. WORKING LUNCH—Council Hot Topics—Council members will discuss existing and emerging hot topics (lunch catered); presentation on the Institute for Applied Ecology cookoff (status and update)—All Council members. FISO—Council members will discuss the status of the invasive species funding initiative for Oregon. Council Administrative Updates—Council members will discuss: • Status of new OISC beta website • Status of OISC budget • Pest risk assessments for 100 Worst List (select 6 for December 2013). Boat Inspection Stations update will be provided on the 2013 boat inspection station program, and members will discuss how to advance regional concepts • JULY 10 – FIELD TRIP- Leave Hotel at 7:30am. Stop One – Charleston Boat Basin (8:00am–9:45am). Richard Emlet (OIMB) and the Tunicate team will discuss the tunicate issue in the basin. Travel to Stop Two – 9:45am–10:15am. South Slough National Estuarine Research Reserve (10:15am–noon). Craig Cornu and Steve Rumrill, Scott Groth will discuss the local area and the management plan for South Slough NERR, including their approaches to addressing invasive species issues. Focus on estuarine snail invaders Travel to Stop Three (1:00pm–1:30pm).Shore Acres State Park (1:30pm–3:30pm). Glenn Dolphin on boating, AIS, and coastal aquatic lakes – new boat wash station at Ten Mile Lake.

Meeting Location: Inn at Cross Keys Station 66 NW Cedar Street
Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife 4034 Fairview Industrial Dr SE
Details:
Welcome & Introduction status of of new OISC Coordinator. Hungry Pest, 2013 EDRR Updates for 100 Worst Species: Tunicates, Sudden Oak Death, Zebra/quagga mussels, “A” Weeds, Japanese Beetle/Gypsy Moth, and Feral Pigs.  Discussion on 
Emerging Pests: Brown Mormorated Stinkbug, Spotted Wing Drosophila, and Azalea Lacebug.  Working Lunch: Committee Reports, ODF&W Tour of new headquarters. Feral Cats panel:Q&A, discussion, and next steps

Wednesday, 11/20 (Business Meeting)
OISC Finances, Year End Business, and
Critical Review (Mark Systma)

Short Description: Stop the Invasion: Protection through Prevention An Oregon Invasive Species Council Summit
Meeting Location: Chemeketa Eola Viticulture Center Doak's Ferry Road
ODFW Commission Room - 4034 Fairview Industrial Dr SE
Chemeketa Winema, 4001 Winema Place NE Suite 200
Details:
Report on OISC committee activities to the full Council. Update efforts to engage entities in Japanese beetle eradication funding. Work with aviation industry on messaging to sea plane pilots. Status of Shipping Transport of AIS Task Force request to Senator Dingfelder. Update on Tri-state feral swine outreach campaign. Update on Arundo biofuel project. Asian gypsy moth and ports of entry update.
•	Review of Oregon Attorney General opinion on use of the highway trust fund to support invasives work along Oregon’s highways, and next steps
•	Discuss the budget, fundraising, and pending grants

•	Obtain input on the suggested top 10 2012 stories to include the Oregon Invasive Species Report Card
